sen.j: 庶民の寺子屋においては、『庭訓往来』をはじめとする往来物や『童子教』・『実語教』や『貞永式目』、儒学関連では『三字経』・『大和小学』・『孝経』・『小学』などが採用された。
sen.e: In private elementary schools of the common people, it was adopted Oraimono including "Teikin Orai" and "Dojikyo", "Jitsugokyo", "Joeishikimoku" and books related Confucianism including "Sanjikyo", "Yamato Shogaku", "Kokyo", "Shogaku" etc.

Private elementary schools for the common people adopted for their textbooks like Oraimono, which included "Teikin Orai," as well as "Dojikyo," "Jitsugokyo," "Joeishikimoku," and other books related Confucianism such as "Sanjikyo," "Yamato Shogaku," "Kokyo," "Shogaku," etc.

Private elementary schools for the common people adopted for their textbooks like Oraimono, which included "Teikin Orai," as well as "Dojikyo," "Jitsugokyo," "Joeishikimoku," and other books related Confucianism such as "Sanjikyo," "Yamato Shogaku," "Kokyo," "Shogaku," etc.

sen.j: 幕末の国学の高揚とともに、『大日本史』（一部が刊行されていた）や『日本外史』・『日本政記』・『国史略』など尊皇意識を高める書籍も藩校や一部寺子屋などで採用された。
sen.e: Raising the study of ancient Japanese thought and culture in the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate, books such as "Nihon Gaishi", "Nihon Seiki", "Kokushiryaku" that raised the reverence for the Emperor were adopted in schools of the clans and some of private elementary schools of the common people.

With the rising of the standard of learning on ancient Japanese thought and culture during the latter period of the Tokugawa Shogunate, books such as "Nihon Gaishi," "Nihon Seiki," and "Kokushiryaku," which increased the reverence for the Emperor, were adopted in the schools of the clans and in some of the private elementary schools for the common people.
